instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message:
Hello all,

I got this weird laptop that supposedly wasnt turning on.  I let it charge for a while using a known working motherboard and it eventually turned on. With its original MOBO I notice it charges but does not show the typical lightning bolt on the battery icon, it shows nothing at all, just as if the charger was disconnected, however the charge percentage does go up!  When I use the known good motherboard this issue does not occur. When I log into the computer the charge icon finally appears!

Anyone have any advice on this one?  I"m thinking battery/battery board? Tried the usual resets with no luck.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message:
Did you try other DCIN board?
If the same DCIN board works with other MLB, then you must check <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> circuit on the MLB.
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>/01 voltages.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message: Will report in a bit.  I did swap in the DC in board with no change.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message: This is a normal issue with Mojave and maybe even High Sierra. Don't worry about what the icon shows until logged into MacOS. It's very common.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message: Ooops, I was thinking about Magsafe light; I have read the post in hurry, mea culpa.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge icon til logged in
threads.message: Interesting.  Thank you guys!  When I got the computer it was totally dead however.  Perhaps a battery that is going bad? In order to get it going I did have to use the "transfer over a known good board to charge it trick."
